analyzed: de nyid rgyan gang yin pa de dang / ngang pa rnams kyis skad kyis yid du 'ong ba'i rdzing bu dang / thong pas ma rmos pa dang sa bon ma btab par skyes pa'i lo thog ni 'bras la sogs pa dang / gzhan ni ma bshad pa ste mchod par bya ba'i rgyan ni nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa de dag thams cad sus kyang bdag gir ma byas pa /

original: yid kyis gzung ste thub pa skyes kyi mtshog dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'bul lo //
analyzed: yid kyis gzung ste thub pa skyes kyi mtshog dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'bul lo //

analyzed: rang gi nor ci ste mi 'bur zhe na /

analyzed: de bas bdag gi bsod nams 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: khyed kyi 'bangs su mchi bar bgyi / gus pas te 'tsho ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: zhes gsungs pas so //

translated: From this time on, until enlightenment, I give my bodies in all my lives, and likewise all the substances for my enjoyment, such as horses, elephants, chariots, and so on, and all my virtues, mundane and transcendental, past, future, and present, without regard for the results, for the sake of accomplishing the aims of all sentient beings.

translated: May the very thought that causes them to focus on me with anger or lack of faith become the cause for their accomplishing all their desired aims.

translated: a ship, a ferry, a bridge for those wishing to cross the waters, a staff for those who need a staff, a bed for those who need a bed, a servant for those who need a servant, a wish-fulfilling jewel, a vase of plenty, and a magical cow for those who need them.

analyzed: bdag sngon du ji ltar yin pa gal te da lta yang bslab pa la lhod pa de ltar rang byed na de'i tshe /
translated: If I am now as lax as I was in the past,

original: yang nas yang du ngan song du nad dang 'chi ba dang / rkang lag gcod pa dang / mdung dang mdas phug pa dang / sogs pa'i sgras 'ching ba dang / rdeg pa la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang nas yang du ngan song du nad dang 'chi ba dang / rkang lag gcod pa dang / mdung dang mdas phug pa dang / sogs pa'i sgras 'ching ba dang / rdeg pa la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then again and again I will experience the illnesses and deaths of the miserable realms, the cutting off of my hands and feet, the stabbing with spears and arrows, and so forth.

original: tshogs pa rnyed dkar bshad de /
analyzed: tshogs pa rnyed dkar bshad de /
translated: The difficulty of acquiring the optimum human rebirth is explained.

original: au dum b'a ra'i me tog lta bur sangs rgyas byon pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gnas la dad pa dang / yul dbus su dbang po tshang ba'i mi lus thob pa dang / lus dang sems las su @216a * //
analyzed: au dum b'a ra'i me tog lta bur sangs rgyas byon pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gnas la dad pa dang / yul dbus su dbang po tshang ba'i mi lus thob pa dang / lus dang sems las su @216a * //
translated: It is as rare as the appearance of an udumbara flower for a buddha to appear, for the three jewels to endure, for faith to arise, for a human body to be obtained in a central land with complete faculties, and for body and mind to be fit for practice.

original: rung ba nam zhig thob par 'gyur te rnyed par dka' bas so //
analyzed: rung ba nam zhig thob par 'gyur te rnyed par dka' bas so //
translated: When will I obtain the proper conditions? They are difficult to obtain.

original: nad dang bral ba'i dus dang zas dang gos rnyed pa sla ba dang / rgyal po dang chom rkun la sogs pa'i gnod pa med pa ni nam thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: nad dang bral ba'i dus dang zas dang gos rnyed pa sla ba dang / rgyal po dang chom rkun la sogs pa'i gnod pa med pa ni nam thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: When will I obtain the time free from illness, the ease of obtaining food and clothing, and the absence of harm from kings, thieves, and so on?

original: thob nas kyang lhod par mi bya zhes bshad de /
analyzed: thob nas kyang lhod par mi bya zhes bshad de /
translated: Having obtained them, I will not be negligent.

original: tshe ni skad cig gis slu ba ste /
analyzed: tshe ni skad cig gis slu ba ste /
translated: Life is deceived by the moment.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyi nor brnyas pa yun rings mi gnas pa ltar lus po ste mi rtag pas gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyi nor brnyas pa yun rings mi gnas pa ltar lus po ste mi rtag pas gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as the borrowed wealth of others does not last long, so the body is not grasped by impermanence.

original: de bas da lta 'bad pa ma byas na slar mi lus dge ba la spyod pa 'di lta bu mi thob pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas da lta 'bad pa ma byas na slar mi lus dge ba la spyod pa 'di lta bu mi thob pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, if I do not strive now, I will not obtain this human body again, which is fit for virtuous practice.

original: gzhan yang de ma thob na sdig pa kho na 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de ma thob na sdig pa kho na 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, if I do not obtain it, only evil will arise.

original: lha rnams la yang lha min dang rtsod pas so //
analyzed: lha rnams la yang lha min dang rtsod pas so //
translated: Even among the gods, there is strife with the demigods.

original: gzhan yang gang gi tshe nus pa yod kyang dge ba mi byed pa phyis ngan song gsum gyi sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba ci byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi tshe nus pa yod kyang dge ba mi byed pa phyis ngan song gsum gyi sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba ci byed par 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, what will you do when you are tormented by the sufferings of the three miserable realms, even though you have the ability to do virtue but do not do it?

original: dge ba ma byas par sdig pa bsags na rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba mi dge ba bcu ni ris drug la yod pa'i phyir bde 'gro'i skad kyang med de /
analyzed: dge ba ma byas par sdig pa bsags na rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba mi dge ba bcu ni ris drug la yod pa'i phyir bde 'gro'i skad kyang med de /
translated: If you do not do virtue and accumulate evil, you will not even have a happy rebirth, because the ten natural misdeeds exist in the six realms.

original: bskal pa sa ya brgya phrag la yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskal pa sa ya brgya phrag la yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: You will not have a happy rebirth for a hundred million eons.

original: de bas rgyal bas gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas rgyal bas gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the Victorious One said:

original: mi khom pa dang bral ba'i mi lus rnyed par dka'o //
analyzed: mi khom pa dang bral ba'i mi lus rnyed par dka'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is difficult to obtain a human body free from the eight conditions that lack opportunity.üîΩ‚Äù

original: dpe bshad de /
analyzed: dpe bshad de /
translated: An analogy is taught:üîΩIn the great ocean, a four-sided yoke with a single hole

original: rgya mtsho chen po la khru bzhi pa gnya' shing gi bu ga gcig pu la /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po la khru bzhi pa gnya' shing gi bu ga gcig pu la /
translated: is tossed by the wind.

original: rus sbal mig gcig pa'i mgul pa chud pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rus sbal mig gcig pa'i mgul pa chud pa bzhin no //
translated: A one-eyed turtle living in the ocean comes to the surface once every hundred years.

original: mdo las gsungs pa /
analyzed: mdo las gsungs pa /
translated: A sutra teaches:

original: 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad rgya mtsho chen po gcig tu gyur la /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad rgya mtsho chen po gcig tu gyur la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe entire world becomes a single great ocean.

original: der gnya' shing bu ga gcig yod pa na /
analyzed: der gnya' shing bu ga gcig yod pa na /
translated: In it there is a yoke with a single hole.

original: shar gyi rlung gis nub kyi mthar dang / nub kyi rlung gis shar gyi 'gram du bdas te //
analyzed: shar gyi rlung gis nub kyi mthar dang / nub kyi rlung gis shar gyi 'gram du bdas te //
translated: The wind from the east blows it to the west, and the wind from the west blows it to the east.

original: de bzhin du lho'i rlung gis byang dang / byang gi rlung gis lhor bdas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lho'i rlung gis byang dang / byang gi rlung gis lhor bdas /
translated: Similarly, the wind from the south blows it to the north, and the wind from the north blows it to the south.

original: 'di lta bu'i rgya mtsho la rus sbal mig gcig pa gting nas lo brgya 'das te mgul ba steng du byung nas lta'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i rgya mtsho la rus sbal mig gcig pa gting nas lo brgya 'das te mgul ba steng du byung nas lta'o //
translated: In this ocean, a one-eyed turtle lives at the bottom. After a hundred years have passed, it comes to the surface once, looking around.

original: de la 'ga' zhig tu gnya' shing de mig med pa'i phyogs su song ba na de mi mthong bar de'i mgul pa bu ga der chud de /
analyzed: de la 'ga' zhig tu gnya' shing de mig med pa'i phyogs su song ba na de mi mthong bar de'i mgul pa bu ga der chud de /
translated: Sometimes, if the yoke goes to the place where there is no eye, it does not see it, and its neck enters the hole.

original: de nyid 'dir dpe'o /
analyzed: de nyid 'dir dpe'o /
translated: That is the example here.

original: cis de lta zhe na /
analyzed: cis de lta zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: smras pa / dngos gzhi'i skad cig gcig la byas pa'i sdig pa de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag byung ba'i mtshams med byas la lha sbyin ltar mnar med du bar @216b bskal gcig gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: smras pa / dngos gzhi'i skad cig gcig la byas pa'i sdig pa de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag byung ba'i mtshams med byas la lha sbyin ltar mnar med du bar @216b bskal gcig gnas par gyur na /
translated: It is said that the sin committed in one moment of the main part, such as the thought of harming the Tathagata with evil intent, becomes like Devadatta, who remained in Avici for an intermediate kalpa, having committed the heinous act of causing the blood of the Tathagata to flow.

original: dus thog ma med pa nas bsags pa'i sdig pa las bde 'gror skye ba'i bdam kha ga la yod //
analyzed: dus thog ma med pa nas bsags pa'i sdig pa las bde 'gror skye ba'i bdam kha ga la yod //
translated: How can there be any chance of being born in a happy realm due to evil deeds accumulated since beginningless time?

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa phyung nas zad kyang myong ba'i las dang 'bras bu tsam myong nas byed pa po de las byung ba'i sdug bsngal de las mi grol te /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa phyung nas zad kyang myong ba'i las dang 'bras bu tsam myong nas byed pa po de las byung ba'i sdug bsngal de las mi grol te /
translated: Even if the ripening of karma is extracted and exhausted, the agent is not freed from the suffering that arises from that karma, merely by experiencing the karma and its result.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir de myong zhing sdig pa gzhan sog bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de myong zhing sdig pa gzhan sog bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because while experiencing that, other evil deeds are accumulated.

original: 'gyod cing smras te 'di las gzhan rang slu bar byed pa med de /
analyzed: 'gyod cing smras te 'di las gzhan rang slu bar byed pa med de /
translated: Regretting and saying, ‚ÄúThere is no one else to deceive but myself,‚ÄùüîΩwhat else is there but ignorance?

original: ma rig pa yang 'di las gzhan ci yod 'di lta bu'i dal 'byor thob nas kyang /
analyzed: ma rig pa yang 'di las gzhan ci yod 'di lta bu'i dal 'byor thob nas kyang /
translated: Having obtained such leisure and opportunity,

original: gang dge ba la goms pa ste /
analyzed: gang dge ba la goms pa ste /
translated: one should cultivate virtue.

original: dge ba zhes bya ba'i nor lag tu byung ba lta bu gzhan gyis 'phrog pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba zhes bya ba'i nor lag tu byung ba lta bu gzhan gyis 'phrog pa'o //
translated: It is as if the wealth called ‚Äúvirtue‚Äù has come into one‚Äôs hands, but is taken away by others.

original: dal 'byor rnyed par dka' ba 'di lta bu dang / sdig pa'i stobs rtogs nas kyang rmongs pa'i mthus sgyid lug nas ni le lo can du gyur na de'i tshe dmyal ba la sogs par yun ring du mya ngan thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dal 'byor rnyed par dka' ba 'di lta bu dang / sdig pa'i stobs rtogs nas kyang rmongs pa'i mthus sgyid lug nas ni le lo can du gyur na de'i tshe dmyal ba la sogs par yun ring du mya ngan thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having understood the difficulty of obtaining the freedoms and advantages, and the power of evil, one becomes lazy and indolent through the force of delusion. At that time, one will experience grief for a long time in the hells and so forth.

original: ji ltar sngon du gshin rje'i pho nya rnams kyis ci ste khyod kyis 'di ltar byas pa zhes brjod cing bsdigs pa dang rdeg pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar sngon du gshin rje'i pho nya rnams kyis ci ste khyod kyis 'di ltar byas pa zhes brjod cing bsdigs pa dang rdeg pa la sogs pas so //
translated: As before, the messengers of the Lord of Death will say, ‚ÄúWhy did you do this?‚Äù and they will threaten, beat, and so forth.

original: gzhan yang dmyal ba'i mes bdag yun ring du sreg cing thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang dmyal ba'i mes bdag yun ring du sreg cing thal bar 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, the fire of the hells will burn me for a long time and reduce me to ashes.

original: de shin tu bzod par dka' ba ci ste /
analyzed: de shin tu bzod par dka' ba ci ste /
translated: How can I bear that?

original: ji ltar zhes 'gyod pa me lta bus ma bslabs pa'i sems gdung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes 'gyod pa me lta bus ma bslabs pa'i sems gdung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: How will the fire of remorse burn the mind that has not been trained?

original: las ngan zad pas phan pa de'i sa rnyed pa dka' ba ci zhig ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang mjal bas rnyed par gyur na yang /
analyzed: las ngan zad pas phan pa de'i sa rnyed pa dka' ba ci zhig ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang mjal bas rnyed par gyur na yang /
translated: Having obtained the opportunity to practice virtue, which is difficult to obtain, I have met with a spiritual teacher.

original: shes kyang dmyal ba de dang der khrid de /
analyzed: shes kyang dmyal ba de dang der khrid de /
translated: Even though I know this, I am being led to the hells.

original: sngon du goms pas slar yang de lta'i las bsags pas so //
analyzed: sngon du goms pas slar yang de lta'i las bsags pas so //
translated: By the force of habit, one again accumulates such actions.

original: srid pa la 'gyod par byed pa'i sdug bsngal bden pa bshad nas kun 'byung bshad de /
analyzed: srid pa la 'gyod par byed pa'i sdug bsngal bden pa bshad nas kun 'byung bshad de /
translated: Having explained the truth of suffering, which is the regret about existence, he now explains the truth of origin.

original: don 'di la bdag la sems med du zad sngags kyis rmongs pa ltar sus bdag rmugs pa mi shes bdag gi nang na su zhig yod /
analyzed: don 'di la bdag la sems med du zad sngags kyis rmongs pa ltar sus bdag rmugs pa mi shes bdag gi nang na su zhig yod /
translated: In this matter, I am like one who is without mind, like one who is deluded by a spell. Who does not know that I am stupefied? Who is there within me?

original: nyon mongs pa yod ce na smras pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yod ce na smras pa /
translated: If one says that there are afflictions, he says:

original: lag ba dang rkang pa dang mgo dang mgul ba med pa srid pa nas yang srid pa la mngon par dga' ba chags pa dang bcas zhe sdang la sogs pa'i sgras nga rgyal la sogs pa bag la nyal bcu phye bas /
analyzed: lag ba dang rkang pa dang mgo dang mgul ba med pa srid pa nas yang srid pa la mngon par dga' ba chags pa dang bcas zhe sdang la sogs pa'i sgras nga rgyal la sogs pa bag la nyal bcu phye bas /
translated: Without hands, feet, head, and neck, delighting in existence and in a new existence, attached, with the word ‚Äúhatred‚Äù he indicates the ten latent proclivities such as pride.

original: brgya phrag gcig dang nyi shu dpa' bo yang min la shes rab can yang ma yin de dag gis ci ste bdag bran bzhin byas /üîΩ'di dag gi gnyen po lam @217a * //
analyzed: brgya phrag gcig dang nyi shu dpa' bo yang min la shes rab can yang ma yin de dag gis ci ste bdag bran bzhin byas / 'di dag gi gnyen po lam @217a * //
translated: One hundred and twenty times, I am not a hero, nor am I wise. What is the use of my being like a slave to them?

original: bsgom pa'i don du sngon du 'gro ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i don du sngon du 'gro ba 'di yin no //
translated: For the sake of cultivating the path, which is their antidote, this is the preliminary.

original: yang 'di ni ngo mtshar che ste bdag rang gi sems rten la bdag la 'jigs pa'i dogs pa yang med bzhin du /
analyzed: yang 'di ni ngo mtshar che ste bdag rang gi sems rten la bdag la 'jigs pa'i dogs pa yang med bzhin du /
translated: Moreover, this is amazing: without any fear for myself,

original: gnod par byed pa de dag de lta bu mi rigs pa byed pa rnams la yang bdag mi khro ba 'di ni gnas ma yin pa la dad pa smad /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa de dag de lta bu mi rigs pa byed pa rnams la yang bdag mi khro ba 'di ni gnas ma yin pa la dad pa smad /
translated: I am not angry at those who harm me, who act in such an unreasonable way.

original: lha dang lha min rnams dgrar gyur kyang gsod nus kyi mnar med dmyal ba'i me nang du khrid par mi nus so //
analyzed: lha dang lha min rnams dgrar gyur kyang gsod nus kyi mnar med dmyal ba'i me nang du khrid par mi nus so //
translated: Even if the gods and demigods were to become my enemies, they could not lead me into the fires of the Avƒ´ci hell.üîΩWhat kind of fire is that?

original: me ji lta bu zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: me ji lta bu zhe na smras pa /
translated: It is said:

original: gzhan lta zhog lha'i bzhugs gnas ri rab kyi 'ang me gang dang phrad pas thal ba yang mi dmigs par 'gyur te shin tu mi bzad pas so ;
analyzed: gzhan lta zhog lha'i bzhugs gnas ri rab kyi 'ang me gang dang phrad pas thal ba yang mi dmigs par 'gyur te shin tu mi bzad pas so ;
translated: Forget about others, even the fire of Mount Meru, the abode of the gods, would become so weak when it encounters that fire that not even its ashes can be found.

original: / me de la nyon mongs stobs can dgra mtshams med las kyi rgyus skad cig tu 'dor ro //
analyzed: / me de la nyon mongs stobs can dgra mtshams med las kyi rgyus skad cig tu 'dor ro //
translated: Because of the unbearable suffering, the powerful afflictions, the enemies, and the causes of the crimes with immediate retribution, one is instantly cast into that fire.

original: 'di dag kho na lta ci ste khros pa zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag kho na lta ci ste khros pa zhe na /
translated: Why be angry at just these?

original: smras pa / lha la sogs pa dgra bo gzhan la tshe 'di lta bu'i ring ba 'khor ba ltar thog mtha' med de /
analyzed: smras pa / lha la sogs pa dgra bo gzhan la tshe 'di lta bu'i ring ba 'khor ba ltar thog mtha' med de /
translated: Objection: The gods and so on are enemies, but not like this. Samsara is beginningless and endless.

original: ji ltar bdag gi nyon mongs pa'i dgra bo rnams las so ;
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gi nyon mongs pa'i dgra bo rnams las so ;
translated: Reply: Not so, because they are not like the afflictions, my enemies.

original: / lha la sogs pa thams cad de'i 'dod pa bzhin du mnyes par byas na phan par byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: / lha la sogs pa thams cad de'i 'dod pa bzhin du mnyes par byas na phan par byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The gods and so on, when pleased according to one's wishes, will be helpful.

original: nyon mongs pa ni bstan par byas na shin tu sdug bsngal bar byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni bstan par byas na shin tu sdug bsngal bar byed do //
translated: But the afflictions, when taught, will cause great suffering.

original: dug sbrul kho bo ma byin pas dug 'phel ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dug sbrul kho bo ma byin pas dug 'phel ba bzhin no //
translated: Like a poisonous snake, they increase their poison when not given to.

original: 'di ltar bar med pa rgyun du sdug bsngal gyi tshogs bskyed pa'i rgyu yun rings kyi dgra bo rnams bdag gi sems la 'jigs pa med cing ldog pa med par gnas pa na bdag la sems la sems yod na 'khor ba la dga' bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bar med pa rgyun du sdug bsngal gyi tshogs bskyed pa'i rgyu yun rings kyi dgra bo rnams bdag gi sems la 'jigs pa med cing ldog pa med par gnas pa na bdag la sems la sems yod na 'khor ba la dga' bar mi rigs so //
translated: Thus, when these enemies, who are the cause of the mass of suffering that is generated continuously and without break for a long time, remain in my mind without fear and without being turned away, if I have a mind, it is not right to delight in samsara.

original: slar yang smad par 'os pa nyid bshad de /
analyzed: slar yang smad par 'os pa nyid bshad de /
translated: Again, it is explained that they are worthy of contempt.

original: srid pa kho na btson khang ste de'i srung ma ni thar du mi ster ba ste /
analyzed: srid pa kho na btson khang ste de'i srung ma ni thar du mi ster ba ste /
translated: Samsara is the prison, and the guards who do not let one out are these very messengers of Yama, the executioners of the hells, etc.

original: dmyal ba la sogs par yang gsod bya gsod mkhan gshin rje'i pho nya 'di dag nyid bdag gi yid kyi khang pa na gang chags pa'i rang bzhin dra ba der gal te gnas na dgra bo stobs ldan btsan po sten pa de tshe bdag la bde ba ga
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs par yang gsod bya gsod mkhan gshin rje'i pho nya 'di dag nyid bdag gi yid kyi khang pa na gang chags pa'i rang bzhin dra ba der gal te gnas na dgra bo stobs ldan btsan po sten pa de tshe bdag la bde ba ga
translated: If they are dwelling in the net of my own nature, which is attached to the house of my mind, how can I have happiness when I am serving powerful and mighty enemies?

original: la yod / gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas ji srid du dgra bo de dag mngon sum nyid du bsad par ma gyur pa de srid du bdag brtson pa mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: la yod / gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de bas ji srid du dgra bo de dag mngon sum nyid du bsad par ma gyur pa de srid du bdag brtson pa mi 'dor ro //
translated: Since this is so, I will not give up my efforts until I have actually killed those enemies.

original: gang gi phyir nyes pa chung ngu'i dgra la yang khro ba brtan pa nga rgyal bdo ba rnams dgra de ma bcom par gnyid du mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyes pa chung ngu'i dgra la yang khro ba brtan pa nga rgyal bdo ba rnams dgra de ma bcom par gnyid du mi 'gro'o //
translated: For, even with respect to a small fault, those who are firm in their anger, who are full of pride, do not sleep until they have killed that enemy.

original: gzhan yang rang gi ngang gis 'chi ba 'chi ba'i @217b chos can sdug bsngal ba'i skye bo g-yul du btsan thabs su bsad pa'i phyir sngar 'tshe ba de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang gi ngang gis 'chi ba 'chi ba'i @217b chos can sdug bsngal ba'i skye bo g-yul du btsan thabs su bsad pa'i phyir sngar 'tshe ba de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is it that one who is naturally subject to death, a suffering person, is killed in battle?

original: g-yul gyi mtshon cha rnams kyis phog pa'i sdug bsngal khyad du bsad nas /
analyzed: g-yul gyi mtshon cha rnams kyis phog pa'i sdug bsngal khyad du bsad nas /
translated: One should disregard the suffering of being struck by weapons in battle.

original: bsgrub bya'i don ma grub par phyir phyogs par mi byed do //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i don ma grub par phyir phyogs par mi byed do //
translated: One should not turn back without accomplishing the purpose of the one for whose sake one is fighting.

original: bshad pa rnams las khyad par bshad de /
analyzed: bshad pa rnams las khyad par bshad de /
translated: This is explained in the commentaries.üîΩOne should not be lazy, that is, one should not be discouraged, thinking, ‚ÄúI am unable to kill the enemy who is always trying to kill me and who is guilty of many faults.‚Äù

original: rtag tu sdug bsngal ma lus byed pa nyes pa med par dgra bo gsod par brtson pa bdag la sgyid lug ni mi nus pas le lo dang / yi chad sems rmugs pa ni sdug bsngal brgya phrag byung bar gyur kyang /
analyzed: rtag tu sdug bsngal ma lus byed pa nyes pa med par dgra bo gsod par brtson pa bdag la sgyid lug ni mi nus pas le lo dang / yi chad sems rmugs pa ni sdug bsngal brgya phrag byung bar gyur kyang /
translated: One should not be depressed, that is, one should not be mentally sluggish, even if one encounters a hundred difficulties.

original: rgyu gang gis te le lo mi rigs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba phyi ma dag la sogs pa'i dgos pa med kyang dgra bo'i snying la sogs par phog pa'i mtshon rgyan bzhin du dga' ba'i sems kyis 'chang bar byed pa na 'gro ba mtha' dag sangs rgyas par byed pa la go bgos pa bdag la

analyzed: nya bsad pa'i phyir grang dus su chu grang ba la 'jug pa dang / gdol pa rnams gzhan gyi nor rku ba'i phyir mtshan mo tsher ma can gyi lam la char dang rlung dang dug sbrul la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa la ma ltos par gsod par dogs pa yang rab tu 'jug pa dang /

analyzed: zhing pa yang tsha grang gi sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang / sogs pa'i sgras rngon pa dang / 'dod pa log par g-yem par tshol ba dang / tshong pa dang bran la sogs pa las dman pa byed pa rnams sdug bsngal bzod pa na skyes bu'i don grub par 'dod pa bdag gis ci ste mi bzod /

analyzed: gzhan yang phyogs bcur nam mkha' khyab pa'i 'gro ba rnams nyon mongs pa las sgrol ba'i don du dam bcas nas /

analyzed: gnas med pa'i phyir rtsa ba nas bton pa slar ldang mi nus so //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'di rnams de kho na nyid mthong ba'i shes rab tsam gyis gzhom par bya ba yin no //

original: kun slong bshad de /
analyzed: kun slong bshad de /

original: dpe bshad de /

analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs pa skye bo ma rungs pa'i nang du dus thams cad du bsrung bar bya'o //

original: rmas bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal chung ste /
analyzed: rmas bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal chung ste /

original: de la 'jigs shing rma nan tan gyis bsrung na /

analyzed: bsdus 'joms kyi ris lus 'joms pa yin kyang de'i sdug bsngal sems kho na la'o //

original: de ltar byas na yon tan ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar byas na yon tan ci zhe na /

original: smras pa / spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: mi rigs pa byed pa'i skye bo rnams la sdang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi rigs pa byed pa'i skye bo rnams la sdang bar mi bya'o //

analyzed: lang tsho rnams kyi nang du yang mi chags shing bag yod par bya'o //
translated: One should not be attached to the young, but should be heedful.

original: de bstan par bya zhing bshad de /
analyzed: de bstan par bya zhing bshad de /
translated: That will be taught and explained.

original: snam sbyar la sogs pa rnying pa dang / gdan gding ba dang phyag la sogs pa'i bkur sti dang / lus dang tshe dang dge ba gzhan dag gang bdag gi don du gyur pa de dag thams cad nyams kyang bla'i sems ni nam yang nyams par mi bya'o //

original: de yang kho gzhan gyi yon tan la dga' bar zhes yid la bya'o //
analyzed: de yang kho gzhan gyi yon tan la dga' bar zhes yid la bya'o //
translated: They should praise others for their good qualities, even if they are not good qualities.

original: gzhan gyi yon tan la phrag dog spang bar bshad de /üîΩdman @224b pa bar ma mchog rnams kyi gang rung brtsams pa de sdug bsngal gyi phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yon tan la phrag dog spang bar bshad de /üîΩdman @224b pa bar ma mchog rnams kyi gang rung brtsams pa de sdug bsngal gyi phyir ma yin te /
translated: They should praise others for their good qualities, even if they are not good qualities

original: 'on kyang dga' ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dga' ba'i phyir te /
translated: But, in order to be happy,

original: dga' ba de nor rdzas btang yang rnyed par dka'/
analyzed: dga' ba de nor rdzas btang yang rnyed par dka'/
translated: that happiness is difficult to obtain by giving up wealth.

original: 'dir ni 'bad pa med par bsgrubs pas ci ste spong /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'bad pa med par bsgrubs pas ci ste spong /
translated: Here, it is accomplished without effort. Why should one give it up?

original: de bas dga' ba'i bde ba spyad par bya /
analyzed: de bas dga' ba'i bde ba spyad par bya /
translated: Therefore, one should enjoy the happiness of joy.

original: phrag dog gi yul gzhan gyis 'bad de bsgrubs pa'i yon tan rnams kyis so //
analyzed: phrag dog gi yul gzhan gyis 'bad de bsgrubs pa'i yon tan rnams kyis so //
translated: The objects of envy are the qualities accomplished by others through effort.

original: 'dir khyad par bshad de 'dir gzhan gyi yon tan la dga' bas skye ba 'di la god med de ci yang ma brlag / skye ba phyi ma la bde ba che ste gzhan gyi yon tan la bstod pas so //
analyzed: 'dir khyad par bshad de 'dir gzhan gyi yon tan la dga' bas skye ba 'di la god med de ci yang ma brlag / skye ba phyi ma la bde ba che ste gzhan gyi yon tan la bstod pas so //
translated: Here, a distinction is explained: here, by delighting in the qualities of others, there is no loss in this life, nothing is lost at all; and in future lives, there is great happiness, by praising the qualities of others.

original: gzhan gyi yon tan la mi bzod na 'jig rten gnyi ga la skyon te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yon tan la mi bzod na 'jig rten gnyi ga la skyon te /
translated: If one is intolerant of the qualities of others, there is a fault in both worlds.

original: 'dir mi dga' bas sdug bsngal zhing pha rol du yang zhe sdang gis sdug bsngal che'o //
analyzed: 'dir mi dga' bas sdug bsngal zhing pha rol du yang zhe sdang gis sdug bsngal che'o //
translated: Here, by not delighting, one suffers, and in the next world, by hatred, one suffers greatly.

original: byed par rigs pa yang bslab par bya bar bshad de /
analyzed: byed par rigs pa yang bslab par bya bar bshad de /
translated: What is proper to do is explained as what should be practiced.

original: yid ches pa'i tshig dang / phan tshun 'brel pa dang / don la the tshom mi 'byung ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / rnar snyan pa dang ; snying rje'i rgyu mthun pa dang / 'jam pa dang / ran pa'i tshig gis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i tshig dang / phan tshun 'brel pa dang / don la the tshom mi 'byung ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / rnar snyan pa dang ; snying rje'i rgyu mthun pa dang / 'jam pa dang / ran pa'i tshig gis brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should speak with words that are trustworthy, connected, free of doubt, pleasing, delightful, in accord with compassion, gentle, and appropriate.

original: ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: How should one look?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / drang ba dang ni kyog po ma yin pa dga' bas gzhol ba'i mig gis /
analyzed: smras pa / drang ba dang ni kyog po ma yin pa dga' bas gzhol ba'i mig gis /
translated: With eyes that are straight, not crooked, and that descend with joy,

original: skom pas chu ltar btung zhing sems can la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: skom pas chu ltar btung zhing sems can la blta bar bya'o //
translated: one should look at sentient beings as if drinking them in with thirst.

original: chags pa dang / sdang ba dang gti mug gis ma yin gyi /
analyzed: chags pa dang / sdang ba dang gti mug gis ma yin gyi /
translated: Not with attachment, aversion, or confusion,üîΩbut rather with a mind of love.

original: 'on kyang 'di dag nyid la sogs pa go sla ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di dag nyid la sogs pa go sla ba'o //
translated: These and others are easy to understand.

original: bslab btus las /
analyzed: bslab btus las /
translated: The Siksasamuccaya says:

original: kun du rtsa bkrol med par 'jam //
analyzed: kun du rtsa bkrol med par 'jam //
translated: Without playing around, gently,

original: nyung ba yid du 'ong smras pa'i //
analyzed: nyung ba yid du 'ong smras pa'i //
translated: speaking little that is pleasing,

original: skye bo skal ldan gzhol bar byed //
analyzed: skye bo skal ldan gzhol bar byed //
translated: one should attract the fortunate.

original: tshang mar smra ba 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: tshang mar smra ba 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: Otherwise, one will be despised.

original: zhes so // bka' bsdu ba las /
analyzed: zhes so // bka' bsdu ba las /
translated: The Vinaya-samgraha says:

original: ji ltar mthong ba tsam gyis 'gro ba rnams dang bar 'gyur ba de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba tsam gyis 'gro ba rnams dang bar 'gyur ba de ltar bya'o //
translated: I will act in such a way that beings will be happy just by seeing me.

original: gang gi phyir sems can yongs su smin par byed pa las bya ba gzhan 'di la med do zhes so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can yongs su smin par byed pa las bya ba gzhan 'di la med do zhes so //
translated: Because there is no other action than this for bringing sentient beings to full maturity.

original: de ltar ma byas na /
analyzed: de ltar ma byas na /
translated: If you do not act in this way,

original: bslab btus las /üîΩrgyal ba'i myu gu yid gcugs par //
analyzed: bslab btus las / rgyal ba'i myu gu yid gcugs par //
translated: as the Shikshasamucchaya says:üîΩHaving disparaged the Bodhisattvas,

original: ma gyur pa la smad byas nas //üîΩthal bas bkab pa'i me bzhin du //
analyzed: ma gyur pa la smad byas nas // thal bas bkab pa'i me bzhin du //
translated: who are the sprouts of the Victorious Ones,üîΩyou will burn in the hells and other such places,

original: dmyal la sogs par 'jig rten bsreg //
analyzed: dmyal la sogs par 'jig rten bsreg //
translated: like a fire covered with ashes.

original: 'dir yang bya bar 'os par bshad de /üîΩyi dam du byas pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / mngon par zhen pa las byung ba shin tu dang bas byas pa dang / gnyen po las byung ba nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po stong pa nyid @225a * //
analyzed: 'dir yang bya bar 'os par bshad de / yi dam du byas pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / mngon par zhen pa las byung ba shin tu dang bas byas pa dang / gnyen po las byung ba nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po stong pa nyid @225a * //
translated: Here, too, it is explained that you should do what is right.

original: bsgom pa la sogs pa dang / yon tan gyi zhing sangs rgyas la sogs pa dang / phan pa'i zhing pha ma la sogs pa dad /
analyzed: bsgom pa la sogs pa dang / yon tan gyi zhing sangs rgyas la sogs pa dang / phan pa'i zhing pha ma la sogs pa dad /
translated: The generosity and so forth that you have pledged to practice, the generosity and so forth that you have practiced with great faith and without any attachment, the generosity and so forth that you have practiced as an antidote, such as the meditation on emptiness as an antidote to the afflictions, the generosity and so forth that you have practiced toward a field of good qualities, such as the Buddhas, and the generosity and so forth that you have practiced toward a field of benefit, such as your parents,

original: sdug bsngal ba nad pa la sogs pa la phan par byas pas 'bras bu gzhal du med pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba nad pa la sogs pa la phan par byas pas 'bras bu gzhal du med pa'o //
translated: The result is immeasurable, since one benefits the sick and so on.

original: rtag tu bya bar bshad de /
analyzed: rtag tu bya bar bshad de /
translated: It is explained that one should always practice generosity,

original: brtson pa ni le lo med cing sdang ba yang rang gzhan gyi don ma bskul bar ngang gis byed pa bzhin du las thams cad la gzhan la go skabs mi 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: brtson pa ni le lo med cing sdang ba yang rang gzhan gyi don ma bskul bar ngang gis byed pa bzhin du las thams cad la gzhan la go skabs mi 'byed pa'o //
translated: since the diligent are not lazy and are hostile to laziness, and they naturally do what is to be done for oneself and others without being urged to do so, and they do not give others an opportunity to do otherwise.

original: rim pas byed par bshad de /
analyzed: rim pas byed par bshad de /
translated: It is explained that one should practice generosity in stages,

original: gong nas gong du sbyin pa las tshul khrims dang / de las bzod pa mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gong nas gong du sbyin pa las tshul khrims dang / de las bzod pa mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: since it is said that morality is superior to generosity, and patience is superior to morality, and so on.

original: de bas dman pa'i ched du mchog gtang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas dman pa'i ched du mchog gtang bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not give up the superior for the sake of the inferior.

original: 'o na sbyin pa'i dus su tshul khrims la gang gi phyir btang snyoms bshad pa'o zhes pa dang / 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sbyin pa'i dus su tshul khrims la gang gi phyir btang snyoms bshad pa'o zhes pa dang / 'gal zhe na /
translated: But if one is practicing generosity, why is it explained that one should be indifferent to morality?

original: legs spyad ni bslab pa gong ma ste /
analyzed: legs spyad ni bslab pa gong ma ste /
translated: Good conduct is the higher training.

original: de nyid dge ba'i chu bsrung bas rags yin te /
analyzed: de nyid dge ba'i chu bsrung bas rags yin te /
translated: Since it protects the water of virtue, it is coarse.

original: de ma gtogs pas gong ma gtang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ma gtogs pas gong ma gtang bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not give up the higher for the sake of the lower.

original: ji ltar bsam gtan gzhag ste 'ong bar 'dod pa'i skye bo rnams la chos kyi sbyin pa bla na med pa byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar bsam gtan gzhag ste 'ong bar 'dod pa'i skye bo rnams la chos kyi sbyin pa bla na med pa byed do //
translated: Just as the gift of Dharma is the highest for those who wish to come to the meditative absorptions,

original: bsam gtan tshul khrims kyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan tshul khrims kyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because meditative absorption is a limb of morality.

original: 'dod pa rnams tshim par ma byas na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams tshim par ma byas na ltung ba'o //
translated: It is a downfall if you do not satisfy the desires of others.

original: de ltar bshad pa'i don rtogs nas gzhan don du rtag par brtson 'grus dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa'i don rtogs nas gzhan don du rtag par brtson 'grus dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: Having understood the meaning explained in this way, you should always be diligent for the sake of others.

original: 'o na ma las 'da' ba ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ma las 'da' ba ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it that you transcend the world?

original: smras pa / thugs rje can gzhan don gzigs pa la bkag pa yang gnang ngo //
analyzed: smras pa / thugs rje can gzhan don gzigs pa la bkag pa yang gnang ngo //
translated: It is said that the compassionate one, who sees the benefit for others, is allowed to transgress the rules.

original: gzhan yang sems can gyi don gzigs nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can gyi don gzigs nas /
translated: Moreover, having seen the benefit for sentient beings,

original: mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / mi gsod pa yang bshad do //
analyzed: mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / mi gsod pa yang bshad do //
translated: it is explained that he engages in sexual activity and kills.

original: dge slong gis 'bras gsol ba na /
analyzed: dge slong gis 'bras gsol ba na /
translated: When a monk eats rice,

original: log par ltung ba ni rkang lag la sogs pa bcad pa dang / mgon med pa ni skyob pas stong pa dang / brtul zhugs la gnas ni sdom pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: log par ltung ba ni rkang lag la sogs pa bcad pa dang / mgon med pa ni skyob pas stong pa dang / brtul zhugs la gnas ni sdom pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: he is said to be one who has fallen, one who has cut off his hands and so forth, one who is without a protector, one who is empty of refuge, and one who abides in discipline, one who possesses vows.

original: de dag la skal ba byin nas /
analyzed: de dag la skal ba byin nas /
translated: Having given them a share,

original: tshad bar mar gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshad bar mar gsol bar bya'o //
translated: he should eat the remaining food.

original: ji ltar lus dang sems las su rung ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar lus dang sems las su rung ba'o //
translated: He should make his body and mind serviceable.

original: snam sbyar dang bla gos dang mthang gos te chos gos gsum ma gtogs pa gzhan lhag pa gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: snam sbyar dang bla gos dang mthang gos te chos gos gsum ma gtogs pa gzhan lhag pa gtang bar bya'o //
translated: He should give away all his possessions, except the three robes of a monk, the patched robe, the upper robe, and the lower robe.

original: 'o na de yang ci ste mi gtong zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de yang ci ste mi gtong zhe na /
translated: Why should he not give away even these?üîΩHe says:

original: smras pa / dam pa rnams kyi chos sam /
analyzed: smras pa / dam pa rnams kyi chos sam /
translated: The good man should not give away the Dharma,

original: yang na dam pa yang yin chos kyang yin /
analyzed: yang na dam pa yang yin chos kyang yin /
translated: or that which is good and Dharma,

original: yang na de sbyin byed pa'i lus gzhan sbyin @225b ba'i don du gnod par mi bya /
analyzed: yang na de sbyin byed pa'i lus gzhan sbyin @225b ba'i don du gnod par mi bya /
translated: or his body, which is the instrument of giving, for the sake of giving.

original: de ltar lus la gnod par mi bya zhing lhag mgo sla'o //
analyzed: de ltar lus la gnod par mi bya zhing lhag mgo sla'o //
translated: Thus, he should not injure his body, but should be sparing of the rest.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since this is so,

original: ma dag pa gnyen dang gnyen ma yin pa la mi mnyam pa'i snying rje'i bsam pa yod kyi bar srog gtang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: ma dag pa gnyen dang gnyen ma yin pa la mi mnyam pa'i snying rje'i bsam pa yod kyi bar srog gtang bar mi bya'o //
translated: he should not give up his life as long as he has a discriminatory attitude of compassion toward friends and strangers.

original: thams cad las sems mnyam par gyur ba'i tshe de gtang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad las sems mnyam par gyur ba'i tshe de gtang bar mi bya'o //
translated: But when he has an attitude of sameness toward all, then he should give up his life.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar byas na 'gyod pa la sogs pa med pas nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar byas na 'gyod pa la sogs pa med pas nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because if one acts in this way, one does not fall into regret, etc.

original: mthong lam thob nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthong lam thob nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: after attaining the path of insight.

original: chos bstan pa ni gdod bshad de /
analyzed: chos bstan pa ni gdod bshad de /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is explained right after that.

original: chos ni gsung rab yan lag dgu'o //
analyzed: chos ni gsung rab yan lag dgu'o //
translated: The Dharma is the ninefold scripture.

original: legs par mi gnas zhes kun dang sbyar ro ;
analyzed: legs par mi gnas zhes kun dang sbyar ro ;
translated: The phrase not properly situated is to be construed with each of the above terms.

original: / lha dang klu la sogs pas dam pa'i chos mchod par 'os pa yin pas /
analyzed: / lha dang klu la sogs pas dam pa'i chos mchod par 'os pa yin pas /
translated: The Dharma is worthy of worship by gods, nagas, etc.

original: de la ma bstan na de dag gis smod par 'gyur ba dang / chos ston pa po la yang ltung ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la ma bstan na de dag gis smod par 'gyur ba dang / chos ston pa po la yang ltung ba 'byung ste /
translated: If one does not teach it, they will reproach one, and the one who teaches the Dharma will incur a downfall,

original: bkag pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bkag pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is obstructing the Dharma.

original: mgo g-yogs pa dang mgo dkris pa la sogs pa la chos bshad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mgo g-yogs pa dang mgo dkris pa la sogs pa la chos bshad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not teach the Dharma to those who cover their heads, who wear their upper garments like women, etc.

original: zab ni blo dman pas rab mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zab ni blo dman pas rab mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma is profound because it is not understood by those of weak intellect.

original: rgya che ba ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa blor mi shong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgya che ba ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa blor mi shong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is vast because it is beyond the scope of the imagination with regard to miracles, etc.

original: dman pa ni mos pa dman pa'o //
analyzed: dman pa ni mos pa dman pa'o //
translated: It is lowly because of low aspiration.

original: mi bshad ces gong ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi bshad ces gong ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase one should not teach is to be construed with each of the above terms.

original: bud med min ni dben par skyes ba med par ro //
analyzed: bud med min ni dben par skyes ba med par ro //
translated: Not a woman means not born in a solitary place.

original: dman pa ni nyan thos dang rang rgyal gyi theg pa dang / mchog ni theg pa chen po ste /
analyzed: dman pa ni nyan thos dang rang rgyal gyi theg pa dang / mchog ni theg pa chen po ste /
translated: Inferior means the vehicles of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, and superior means the Mahayana.

original: gnyi ga nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pas so //
analyzed: gnyi ga nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pas so //
translated: Both are antidotes to the afflictions.

original: theg pa chen po'i chos kyi sdod ni nyan thos kyi chos la mi sbyar ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos kyi sdod ni nyan thos kyi chos la mi sbyar ro //
translated: The Mahayana Dharma is not applied to the Dharma of the Sravakas.

original: spyod pa ni bslab pa sdom pa ste /
analyzed: spyod pa ni bslab pa sdom pa ste /
translated: Practice is the vow of training.

original: de spangs la mdo sde dang sngags zlos pa kho nas thar pa thob po zhes 'dod pa bskyed par mi bya'o ;
analyzed: de spangs la mdo sde dang sngags zlos pa kho nas thar pa thob po zhes 'dod pa bskyed par mi bya'o ;
translated: Having abandoned that, one should not generate the desire to attain liberation solely through reciting sutras and mantras.

original: / so shing dang mchil ma 'dor ba ni bkag pa'i phyogs su yin gyi /
analyzed: / so shing dang mchil ma 'dor ba ni bkag pa'i phyogs su yin gyi /
translated: Throwing out tooth sticks and spittle is in the category of prohibitions,

original: chu dang longs spyod pa'i phyogs su ma yin /
analyzed: chu dang longs spyod pa'i phyogs su ma yin /
translated: but not in the category of enjoying water.

original: gcig ba la sogs pa yang mi dor te bkag pas so //
analyzed: gcig ba la sogs pa yang mi dor te bkag pas so //
translated: One should not throw away even a single thing, because it is prohibited.

original: kha bkang ba dang / su su dang phu phu'i sgra dang bcas pa dang / kha gdangs nas bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: kha bkang ba dang / su su dang phu phu'i sgra dang bcas pa dang / kha gdangs nas bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not eat with a full mouth, with a smacking sound, or with an open mouth.

original: rkang pa brkyang ste shing stan la sogs par 'dug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rkang pa brkyang ste shing stan la sogs par 'dug par mi bya'o //
translated: Do not sit with your legs stretched out on a wooden seat, etc.

original: dus mnyam du lag pa gnyis mnye bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dus mnyam du lag pa gnyis mnye bar mi bya'o //
translated: Do not rub both hands together.

original: gzhan gyi bud med gcig pu dang bcas par 'gro ba dang kha cig tu nyal ba dang gdan gcig la 'dug par mi bya ste kun tu chags pa med kyang ma dad pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bud med gcig pu dang bcas par 'gro ba dang kha cig tu nyal ba dang gdan gcig la 'dug par mi bya ste kun tu chags pa med kyang ma dad pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
translated: Do not go alone with a woman, or sleep or sit on a seat with her, even if you are without lust, because it is a cause of lack of faith in others.

original: 'jig rten @226a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten @226a * //
translated: Do not do anything that is not customary in the world,üîΩexcept for the duties of a bodhisattva.üîΩIf you see or hear of someone doing something that is not customary,

original: pa ma dang par byed pa kun bstan bcos la mthong pa dang / yul chos dris te spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: pa ma dang par byed pa kun bstan bcos la mthong pa dang / yul chos dris te spang bar bya'o //
translated: ask about it and then give it up.

original: bslab btus las /
analyzed: bslab btus las /
translated: The Siksasamuccaya says:

original: des na bsdus te sdom pa ni //
analyzed: des na bsdus te sdom pa ni //
translated: Therefore, the summary is this:

original: rin chen sprin las rgyal bas gsungs //üîΩgang gis sems can ma dang pa //
analyzed: rin chen sprin las rgyal bas gsungs // gang gis sems can ma dang pa //
translated: The Victor taught in the Ratnamegha

original: de ni 'bad pas spang bar bya //üîΩzhes so // sdigs mdzub la sogs pa sor mo gcig gis gang yang mi la bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'bad pas spang bar bya // zhes so // sdigs mdzub la sogs pa sor mo gcig gis gang yang mi la bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: that you should make an effort to give upüîΩanything that causes sentient beings to lack faith.üîΩDo not point out anything to anyone with a single finger,

original: lag pa g-yon pas kyang ma yin te ma dad pas so //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pas kyang ma yin te ma dad pas so //
translated: and do not do so with your left hand, because it is not customary.

original: lag pa g-yas pa thams cad kyis dad pa dang ldan zhing lam yang bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa thams cad kyis dad pa dang ldan zhing lam yang bstan par bya'o //
translated: With all his right hand, he should show the path to those who have faith.

original: lag pa brkyang nas don chung ba la gang yang 'phong par mi bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa brkyang nas don chung ba la gang yang 'phong par mi bya'o //

analyzed: bdag ni rang dang gzhan dgrol ba'i phyir sdug bsngal bzod pa las rigs pa gang gis 'jigs /

original: lag pa dang rkang pa dang mgo ster mi nus pas she na /
analyzed: lag pa dang rkang pa dang mgo ster mi nus pas she na /
translated: If you say, I cannot give away my hands, feet, and head,

analyzed: zhes gsungs pas so //

analyzed: bde ba dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa la lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa gcod pa na yang bde ba'i 'du shes kho na skye'o //

analyzed: gnod pa chung ba la sogs goms pa'i dpe bshad de /

translated: Why is it not seen that the cultivation of the perception of harm from lice, flies, mosquitoes, hunger, thirst, etc., and the suffering of great itching, etc., is useless?

original: gzhan yang bze re goms pa byar mi btub ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang bze re goms pa byar mi btub ste /

original: de byas na /
analyzed: de byas na /
translated: For,

analyzed: grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / char dang / rlung dang / lam dang / nad dang / 'chi ba dang / rdeg pa las byung ba'i gnod pas shin tu sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro//

analyzed: sdug bsngal la yang sems pa rtan  na de las ldog pa'o //

analyzed: blo brtan na bzod mi nus pa med par bshad de /

analyzed: dpa' bo 'ga' zhig g-yul du rang gi khrag mthong na lhag par dpa' bar 'gyur /

analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan gyi khrag mthong yang brgyal bar 'gyur te 'jigs pas so //

analyzed: de gnyis sems snying stobs dang / de med pa las byung ste de bas sdug bsngal rnams kyis mi tshugs byos /

original: gnod pa khyad du bsad par bya'o //
analyzed: gnod pa khyad du bsad par bya'o //

original: sdug bsngal byung yang sdug bsngal gang gi de med de bdag med pas rten cing 'brel pa las byung ba mi rtag pa tshor ba tsam du shes nas chos la rab @228b tu dga' pa gtang par mi bya'o //

translated: Even when suffering occurs, you should not give up the joy of Dharma, which is the understanding that suffering is not a self, that it arises from conditions, and that it is impermanent and mere sensation.

analyzed: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams dang g-yul 'gyed par rtsom pa yin pas der gnod pa ni gdon mi za ba'o //

analyzed: dgra bos brgyab pa snying gis len cing gang zhig dgra bo pham par byed pa da ni dpa' bo bsngags pa yin no //

original: gzhan ni 'gyel ba la rdeg pa ltar ro la gnod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni 'gyel ba la rdeg pa ltar ro la gnod pa'o //

original: sdug bsngal gyi yon tan gzhan yang lam dang rjes su mthun pa yod de /üîΩsdug bsngal la skyo ba des nor la sogs pa'i dregs pa sel ba dang / srid pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa la snying rje skye ba dang / sdig pa'i 'bras bu 'di yin par shes nas de la 'jigs pa dang / rgyal ba kho na sdug bsngal zad pa'i lam ston pa po yin pas /

original: rgyal ba la 'dod pa skye'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba la 'dod pa skye'o //
translated: One becomes disenchanted with suffering and abandons pride in one's wealth, etc. One generates compassion for those who are suffering in cyclic existence. One understands that suffering is the result of evil actions and one fears such actions. One generates a desire for the Victor, the one who teaches the path to the cessation of suffering.

original: bzod pa'i don du rigs pa bshad de /
analyzed: bzod pa'i don du rigs pa bshad de /
translated: The meaning of patience is explained by way of reasoning.

original: zas kyi skyon las byung ba mkhris pa dang / rlung dang bad kan dang 'dus pa rnams sdug bsngal chen po'i rgyu la bdag mi khro ste /
analyzed: zas kyi skyon las byung ba mkhris pa dang / rlung dang bad kan dang 'dus pa rnams sdug bsngal chen po'i rgyu la bdag mi khro ste /

original: de dag sems pa med pas /
analyzed: de dag sems pa med pas /

original: bsams bzhin du sdug bsngal mi skyed de /
analyzed: bsams bzhin du sdug bsngal mi skyed de /

analyzed: 'on kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las shes so //

analyzed: de lta yin pas sems pa dang bcas pa la yang khro ba mi rigs te /

analyzed: rkyen nyid kyis khro ba bshad de /

analyzed: sems pa dang bcas pa bsams bzhin du khro bas bdag mi bzod ce na /

original: 'on kyang rgyu de dang de las so //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu de dang de las so //

analyzed: de bas nyes pa ji snyed pa dang sdig pa sna tshogs pa rnams rkyen gyi nus pa las skye bas rang dbang med pa nyid do //

analyzed: 'on kyang 'di yod na 'di 'byung 'di skyes pa las 'di skye'o //

analyzed: gzung ba zhes dpyad nas gnod pa la bzod par bya'o //

analyzed: snying stobs dang / rdul dang mun pa rnams mnyam pa'i gnas skabs rang bzhin gtso bor 'dod pa /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya assert that the state of the equality of sattva, rajas, and tamas is the primal substance.

analyzed: gang bdag ces brtags pa de'ang bdag 'byung bar bya'o zhes bsams bzhin mi skye'o //
translated: The self that is imputed is also not generated intentionally, thinking, ‚ÄúI will arise.‚Äù

analyzed: gang gi phyir gtso bo la sogs pa de ma skyes par med pa nyid mo gsham gyi bu lta bu la skye bar 'dod pa ga la yod /

analyzed: rnam par smin pa 'am gsal ba yang med pa ji ltar skye /

analyzed: bdag la'ang skyon 'di med pa ma yin te rtag pa la skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ri bong gi rva lta bu de la yang skyon de nyid do // ma skyes par ni de med na //
translated: And the same fault applies to the horns of a rabbit.üîΩAnd if it does not exist prior to arising,
